{{Marvel Database:Team Template | Image = Worthy (Earth-616) from Fear Itself Promo 0001.jpg | ImageSize = 300 | Name = Worthy | Aliases = The Worthy | Status = Defunct | Identity = Public | Reality = Earth-616 | BaseOfOperations = Mobile | Leaders = [[Cul Borson (Earth-616)|Serpent]] | CurrentMembers = | FormerMembers = "Breakers:"
[[Angrir (Earth-616)|Angrir]], [[Greithoth (Earth-616)|Greithoth]], [[Kuurth (Earth-616)|Kuurth]], [[Mokk (Earth-616)|Mokk]], [[Nerkkod (Earth-616)|Nerkkod]], [[Nul (Earth-616)|Nul]], [[Sinthea Shmidt (Earth-616)#Fear Itself|Skadi]], [[Skirn (Earth-616)|Skirn]] "Possessed by the hammers:"
[[Carl Creel (Earth-616)|Absorbing Man]] (by Greithoth), [[Attuma (Earth-616)|Attuma]] (by Nerkkod), [[Paul Duval (Earth-616)|Grey Gargoyle]] (by Mokk), [[Cain Marko (Earth-616)|Juggernaut]] (by Kuurth), [[Bruce Banner (Earth-616)|Hulk]] (by Nul), [[Sinthea Shmidt (Earth-616)|Sin]] (by Skadi), [[Benjamin Grimm (Earth-616)|Thing]] (by Angrir), [[Mary MacPherran (Earth-616)|Titania]] (by Skirn) | Allies = [[Exiles (Earth-616)|Exiles]], [[Master Man]], [[Thule Society]], [[Draumar]] | Enemies = [[Mighty (Earth-616)|The Mighty]], [[Avengers (Earth-616)|The Avengers]], [[Future Foundation (Earth-616)|Future Foundation]], [[X-Men (Earth-616)|X-Men]], [[Alpha Flight (Earth-616)|Alpha Flight]], [[Heroes for Hire (Earth-616)|Heroes for Hire]], [[Heavy Hitters (Earth-616)|Heavy Hitters]], [[Defenders (Earth-616)|Defenders]] | Origin = Each granted a mystical hammer which increased their powers and abilities greatly by the Serpent and were controlled by the latter. | PlaceOfFormation = [[Asgard]] | PlaceOfDissolution = | Creators = Matt Fraction; Stuart Immonen | First = Fear Itself #2 | Last = Fear Itself #7 | HistoryText = The Worthy are the [[Cul Borson (Earth-616)|Serpent]]'s elite vanguards and agents of destruction. The eight superpowered beings who can wield those hammers are granted immense magical power, and possessed by the evil spirits that are associated with the Serpent. [[Sinthea Shmidt (Earth-616)|Sin]] was the first one to lift the Hammer of Skadi, which transformed her into [[Sinthea Shmidt (Earth-616)#Fear Itself|Skadi]], who then freed the Serpent from his magical prison. He then sent seven more hammers to Earth, which were found and lifted by seven more people: * [[Cain Marko (Earth-616)|Juggernaut]] became [[Kuurth (Earth-616)|Kuurth: Breaker of Stone]] * [[Attuma (Earth-616)|Attuma]] became [[Nerkkod (Earth-616)|Nerkkod: Breaker of Oceans]] * [[Mary MacPherran (Earth-616)|Titania]] became [[Skirn (Earth-616)|Skirn: Breaker of Men]] * [[Paul Duval (Earth-616)|Grey Gargoyle]] became [[Mokk (Earth-616)|Mokk: Breaker of Faith]] * [[Carl Creel (Earth-616)|Absorbing Man]] became [[Greithoth (Earth-616)|Greithoth: Breaker of Wills]] * [[Benjamin Grimm (Earth-616)|The Thing]] became [[Angrir (Earth-616)|Angrir: Breaker of Souls]] * [[Bruce Banner (Earth-616)|Hulk]] became [[Nul (Earth-616)|Nul: Breaker of Worlds]] Every one of the Worthy helped the Serpent to spread fear around the Earth. The first Worthy to be dispossessed was the Thing, with the help of [[Franklin Richards (Earth-616)|Franklin Richards]] and his reality alteration powers. After the final battle when the Worthy were defeated by [[Mighty (Earth-616)|The Mighty]] and the Serpent killed by [[Thor Odinson (Earth-616)|Thor]], their hammers were taken away from them by [[Odin Borson (Earth-616)|Odin]]. Nul was the only one who seemed to be still free on Earth, for that, Hulk searched for the help of [[Stephen Strange (Earth-616)|Doctor Strange]]. | Equipment = | Transportation = The [[Hammer of Angrir]], [[Hammer of Nerkkod]], [[Hammer of Skadi]], and [[Hammer of Nul]] have been seen allowing their wielders to fly. | Weapons = [[Hammer of Skadi]], [[Hammer of Kuurth]], [[Hammer of Nul]], [[Hammer of Nerkkod]], [[Hammer of Skirn]], [[Hammer of Mokk]], [[Hammer of Greithoth]], [[Hammer of Angrir]]. | Notes = * [[Tarene (Earth-616)|Tarene]] was thought by many to be one of the Worthy, because of her being a Hammer-wielder hero.{{r|Fear Itself: Youth in Revolt Vol 1 #1|#6}} | Trivia = * The way in which the arrival of the hammers on Earth is portrayed seems similar to a scene from the film ''[[Wikipedia:Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen|Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen]]'', in which the Fallen and other Decepticons crash-land on Earth in several different locations. * The Worthy each being able to wield a specific hammer of their own is similar to Thor being worthy to wield [[Mjolnir]], except that their handles are long while Thor's is short. | Links = }} [[Category:Fear Itself]] [[Category:Asgardian Organizations]]
